body.p: The undersigned respectfully represent that at the Sept Term of the Madison Circuit Court for the year 1860, Allen Hunter was convicted of carrying on his person a concealed weapon -- The facts are briefly these -- in the year Mr Hunter took his brother's pistol ^from his home^ to a neighbor's house for the purpose of swapping it to a third person -- The pistol was empty -- he showed it to the commonwealth's witness who says it was not loaded -- he would never have seen it if the petitioner had not pulled it out and showed it to him expressing his purpose to swap it -- We think this ^is^ a case that deserves the executive clemency -- Mr Hunter is a poor, peaceable, quiet young man & the witness who testified against him did it reluctantly, believing that he had no improper motive in carrying it between the two points aforesaid --

Nathan Haines
Jas, A, Moran
E. R. McCreens
Daniel White
Dr Jacob Huguely
Andrew Broadus
Jurymen

State of Kentucky, Madison Circuit Sct

I J M Shackelford Clerk of the Court for said Circuit hereby Certify that Nathan Haines James A Moran, E R McCreary Daniel White Jacob Huguely & Andrew Broaddus whose names appear to the within petition were a part of the Jury that tired and Convicted Allen Hunter of the offence of Carrying Concealed Weapons

Given under my hand this Oct 29' 1860
J M shackelford C m c c
By Geo. J Shackelford D. C.

Madison Cir. Ct.
Remitted
B M
$50 } Concealed Weapons
Allen Hunter
Issd Nov 1. 1860
